altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: The second part of the works of Gregory Nazianzen, translated by the abbat Paul, with select epistles of Basil and Gregory Nazianzen and the Confession of Faith of John, Bishop of Tellā or Constantina. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 63 items.

msItem.title: The second part of the works of Gregory Nazianzen, translated by the abbat Paul, with select epistles of Basil and Gregory Nazianzen and the Confession of Faith of John, Bishop of Tellā or Constantina
msItem.note: This seems to be the third codex mentioned by Assemani in the Bibl. Orient., t. iii., pars, i., p. 23; though, if such be the case, his description of it is rather inaccurate.

msItem.title: The second part of the works of Gregory Nazianzen, translated by the abbat Paul, comprising 17 discourses (from ܠܐ to ܡܙ)
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܦܠܓܘܐ ܐܚܪܝܬܐ ܕܟܬܒܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܓܪܝܓܪܝܘܣ ܐܦܝܣܩܦܐ ܕܐܢܙܝܢܙܘ܀

msItem.title: An Index to the discourses
msItem.rubric: ܩ̈ܦܠܐܐ ܕܦܠܓܘܬܐ ܐܚܪܝܬܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܓܪܝܓܪܝܘܣ ܬܐܘܠܘܓܘܣ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܐܢܙܝܢܙܘ

msItem.title: De moderatione in disputationibus servanda, etc.
msItem.rubric: ܡܛܠ ܫܦܝܪܘܬ ܛܟܣܐ ܕܒܡ̇ܡܠܠܐ̣. ܘܕܠܘ ܕܟܠ ܒܪܢܫܐ̣. ܘܠܐ ܕܟܠ ܙܒܢܐ ܗܝ ܕܢ̇ܡܠܠ ܡܛܠ ܐܠܗܘܬܐ
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, ed. 1778, t. i., p. 579; Migne, t. xxxvi., col. 174

msItem.title: De dogmate et constitutione episcoporum
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 376; Migne, t. xxxv., col. 1066

msItem.title: De Theologia (Theologica secunda)
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 495; Migne, t. xxxvi., col. 26

msItem.title: De seipso, et ad eos, qui ipsum cathedram Constantinopolitanam affectare dicebant
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܢܦܫܗ ܘܠܘܬ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܐܡ̇ܪܝܢ ܗܘܘ ܥܠܘܗܝ̇. ܕܪܐ̇ܓ ܠܟܘܪܣܝܐ ܕܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܝܣ
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 634; Migne, t. xxxvi., col. 266

msItem.title: In seipsum, cum rure rediisset, post ea quae a Maximo perpetrata fuerant
msItem.rubric: ܕܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܕܥܠ ܢܦܫܗ ܟܕ ܡܢ ܐܓܘܪܣܐ ܐܬ݂ܐ̣ ܒܬܪ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܡܟܣܝܡܘܣ
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 471; Migne, t. xxxv., col. 1227

msItem.title: Supremum vale coram centum quinquaginta episcopis
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i.,p. 748; Migne, t. xxxvi., col. 458

msItem.title: De pauperum amore
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 257; Migne, t. xxxv., col. 858

msItem.title: In sanctum Baptisma
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 691; Migne, t. xxxvi., Fol. 359

msItem.title: In sanctum Pascha
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 845; Migne, t. xxxvi., col. 623

msItem.title: Funebris oratio in laudem Basilii magni
msItem.rubric: ܕܥܠ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܒܣܝܠܝܘܣ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܩܣܪܝܐ ܩܦܕܘܩܝܐ
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t.i., p. 770; Migne, t. xxxvi., col. 494

msItem.title: Commentary on this discourse
msItem.rubric: ܟܘ݁ܢܫܐ ܘܦܘܫ̇ܩܐ ܕܬܫ̈ܥܝܬܐ̇. ܗܠܝܢ ܕܐܬ݁ܕܟܪ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܝܬ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ ܓܪܝܓܪܝܘܣ ܒܗܢܐ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܥܘܦܝܐ ܕܪܒܐ ܒܣܝܠܝܘܣ.
msItem.note: Compare Add. 12,153, no. 20, note ; the Greek manuscript Add. 18,231, fol. 319 b;Migne, t. xxxvi., col. 1058; and the Spicilegium Romanum, t. ii., p. 374.

msItem.title: Part of the second part of the works of Gregory Nazianzen, translated by the abbat Paul, comprising 17 discourses (from ܠܐ to ܡܙ)
Part of the second part of the works of Gregory Nazianzen, translated by the abbat Paul, comprising 17 discourses (from ܠܐ to ܡܙ)
msItem.note: This discourse comprises the exhortatio ad Virginem , Opera, t. ii. (Paris, 1840), p. 378, Migne, t. xxxvii., col. 632, and the hymnus Vespertinus , Opera, t. ii., p. 290, Migne, t. xxxvii., col. 511

msItem.title: Ad Cledonium contra Apollinarium epistola secunda
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠ̣ܡܬ݁ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܩܠܝܕܘܢܝܘܣ ܩܫܝܫܐ. ܕܒܣܘܓܐܐ ܕܨ̈ܚܚܐ ܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ̣. ܠܘ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ̇ ܐܠܐ̣ ܕܬܪ̈ܬܝܢ ܪܫܝܡ ܥܠܝܗ̇. ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܝܢ ܦܛܪܝܪܟܐ ܣܐܘܪܐ̣. ܐܝܟ ܕܡܢ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܬܠܬ ܕܠܘܬ ܩܠܝܕܘܢܝܘܣ̇ ܡ̇ܝܬܐ ܡܢܗ̇ ܣܗ̈ܕܘܬܐ.
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. ii., p. 93; Migne, t. xxxvii., col. 193

msItem.title: Ad Cledonium contra Apollinarium epistola prima
msItem.rubric: ܠܘܩܒܠ ܗܪܣܝܣ܆ ܠܘܬܗ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܩܠܝܕܘܢܝܘܣ. ܕܠܗ̇ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܦܛܪܝܪܟܐ ܣܐܘܪܐ ܡܫ̇ܡܗ̣ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. ii., p. 83; Migne, t. xxxvii., col. 175

msItem.title: Adversus Julianum imperatorem prior invectiva
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 78; Migne, t. xxxv., col. 531

msItem.title: Commentary on this discourse
msItem.note: See Add. 18,231, fol. 321a;S. Gregorii Naz. in Julianum Invectivae duae, ed. R. Montagu (Eton, 1610), p. 127;Migne, t. xxxvi., col. 985.

msItem.title: Secunda in Julianum imperatorem invectiva
msItem.rubric: ܥܠܘܗܝ ܟܕ ܥܠܘܗܝ ܕܝܘܠܝܢܘܣ ܡܪܘܕܐ. ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܡܒܙܚܢܐ
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 147; Migne, t. xxxv., col. 663

msItem.title: Commentary on this discourse
msItem.note: See Add. 18,231, fol. 327b;Montagu's edition, p. 159;Migne, t. xxxvi., col. 1035.

msItem.title: The names and sayings of the Seven Sages of Greece
msItem.quote: ܫܡ̈ܗܐ ܘܡ̈ܠܐ ܕܫܒܥܐ ܦܝܠܣ̈ܦܐ܀ ܣܠܘܢ ܐܬܢܝܐ. ܠܐ ܡܕܡ ܣ̇ܓܝ. ܒܝܐܣ ܦܐܪܝܢܝܐ. ܣܘܓܐܐ ܒܝ̈ܫ̣ܐ. ܦܐܪܝܐܢܕܪܘܣ ܩܘܪܢܬܝܐ. ܒܗܘܓܝܐ ܟܠ ܡܕܡ ܐܡ̣ܪ ܬܐܠܘܣ ܡܝܠܝܣܝܐ. ܕܥ ܢܦܫܟ. ܟܝܠܘܢ ܠܩܕܡܘܢܝܐ ܡܢ ܥܪ̈ܒܘܬܐ ܐܫܬܐܠ. ܦܝܛܩܘܣ ܠܙܒܢܐ. (sic) ܕܥ ܙܒܢܐ. ܩܐܠܘܒܘܠܘܣ ܠܝܢܕܝܐ .. ܡܡܫܚܘܬܐ ܛܪܩܐ. ܫܠܡܘ ܫܒܥܐ ܦܝܠܣܘ̈ܦܐ܀
msItem.note: To fill up the second column of fol. 198a, the scribe has inserted the names and sayings of the Seven Sages of Greece.

msItem.title: Oratio habita in consecratione Eulalii Doarensium episcopi
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 253; Migne, t. xxxv., col. 852

msItem.title: In dictum Evangelii: Cum consummasset Jesus hos sermones, etc. Matth. xix. 1 .
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܡܠܬܐ ܕܐܘܢܓܠܝܘܢ. ܟܕ ܫܡ̇ܠܝ ܝܫܘܥ ܡ̈ܠܐ ܗܠܝܢ: ܐܫܩܠ ܡܢ ܓܠܝܠܐ ܘܐܬ݂ܐ ܠܬܚ̈ܘܡܐ ܕܝܗܘܕ ܠܥܒܪ̈ܐ ܕܝܘܪܕܢܢ ܘܢܩ̣ܦܘ ܒܬܪܗ ܟܢܫ̈ܐ ܣ̈ܓܝܐܐ̣ ܘܕܫܪܟܐ
msItem.note: Cf. Opera, t. i., p. 645; Migne, t. xxxvi., col. 282

author.persName: John, Bishop of Tellā or Constantina

msItem.title: The Confession of Faith of John, Bishop of Tellā or Constantina, in the form of a letter to the convents around that city.
msItem.incipit: ܠܥܘܡܪ̈ܐ ܢܟ̈ܦܐ ܘܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ ܕܕܝܪ̈ܬܐ ܕܚܕܪ̈ܝ ܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ: ܘܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܝܬ ܒܟܘܪܐ ܕܝܠܗ̇: ܡܗܝ̈ܡܢܐ ܫܪ̈ܝܪܐ ܗܕ̈ܡܐ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ: ܣܪ̈ܝܓܝ ܒܓܘܫܡܗ ܫܪܝܪܐ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ ܐܠܗܢ: ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡܬ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܚܣܝܐ ܘܩܕܝܫܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܐܦܝܣܩܦܐ ܕܬܠܐ.
msItem.note: Cf. Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. ii., p. 53

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 10 7/8 in. by 7 ¼ , consisting of 226 leaves, some of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 8, 87—90 and 226. Foll. 88 and 89 have been unskilfully repaired. The quires, signed with letters, are 23 in number. Single leaves are missing after foll. 11 and 128. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 34 to 49 lines.

collation.p: The quires, signed with letters, are 23 in number.

item.p: Some of the leaves are much stained and torn, especially foll.8, 87—90 and 226.
Single leaves are missing after foll.11 and 128.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 34 to 49 lines.

handDesc.handNote: This volume is written in a good, regular Estrangela of the viiith or ixth cent. See additions.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.
N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.label: Doxology
Colophon
item.p: After the usual doxology, fol. 226b, we find the name of the scribe,Abraham of Beth-Ṣūrāyā:

p.quote: ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܥܠ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܡܫܡܫܢܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܨܘܪܝܐ ܕܟܬܒ̣.

item.p: A note, subsequent to the colophon, of later date, has been erased, with the exception of the words:
An Arabic note on fol. 1a has been erased.
On the margins of this manuscript, as on those of the preceding, there are written a considerable number of notes, and words in Greek characters.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: added or corrected folio extent values
ADDED: supplied and corrected Syriaca.org URIs for authors
Added generic msItem title(s) based on ancestor title
Question in Word Doc to be Addressed:Syriac in the incipit.
Changed: Files moved to srophe-app-data/data/manuscripts/tei repository.
